channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17194] Assign the new region to the idle server after splitting
item.description: The new regions are assigned to the random servers after splitting, but there always are some idle servers which don’t be assigned any regions on the new cluster. It is a bad start of load balance, hence we should give priority to the idle servers for assignment.
item.summary: Assign the new region to the idle server after splitting

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I evaluate the patch by ycsb. The flow is shown below.

  1. create a table (without pre-split)
  2. log the region distribution periodically
  3. put data via ycsb (recordcount=30000000)

There seems to be no relation between the current getOnlineServersList and the new one below....

1096 public List<ServerName> getOnlineServersList(List<ServerName> keys,
1097 BiFunction<ServerName, ServerLoad, Boolean> predicater) {

Should the new one call the old one internally at least? Or iterate this.onlineServers?

Does this happen alot?

Otherwise the patch looks good to me.

78	  static final BiFunction<ServerName, ServerLoad, Boolean> predicater

79	    = (name, load) -> load.getNumberOfRegions() == 0;

Can you rename 'predicater' to something like 'idleServerPredicator' to be specific?

Also, could you rename the new getOnlineServersList() to something like 'getOnlineServersListWithIdlePredicator' so that it won't cause confusion like stack mentioned?

1096	  public List<ServerName> getOnlineServersList(List<ServerName> keys,

1097	    BiFunction<ServerName, ServerLoad, Boolean> predicater) {

1098	    List<ServerName> names = new ArrayList<>();

1099	    if (keys != null) {

1100	      names.forEach(name -> {

Should it be 'keys.forEach'?

+1 overall

There seems to be no relation between the current getOnlineServersList and the new one below....

I will rename the new method.

Does this happen alot?

Yes, it often happen when we reset and reload data into the testing cluster.

Can you rename 'predicater' to something like 'idleServerPredicator' to be specific?

Also, could you rename the new getOnlineServersList() to something like 'getOnlineServersListWithIdlePredicator' so that it won't cause confusion like stack mentioned?

copy that.

Should it be 'keys.forEach'?

You are right. I will fix it.

Thanks for your review.
more tests for the large PUT to the initial cluster
Apply the feedback from stack and Jerry He in the v1.patch.

This message was automatically generated.

Patch looks good.
one small thing, what about the case servers.size() = 0

-    int numServers = servers == null ? 0 : servers.size();

-    if (numServers == 0) {

+    if (servers == null) {

i should revert these changes...
Thanks for your reviews.
v3.patch addresses the feedback from Jerry He.
TestAvoidCellReferencesIntoShippedBlocks is passed

+        if (load != null && idleServerPredicator != null) {

The null check for idleServerPredicator can be lifted out of the loop.


+  static final Predicate<ServerLoad> SERVER_PREDICATOR

+    = load -> load.getNumberOfRegions() == 0;

Name the variable EMPTY_SERVER_PREDICATOR (SERVER_PREDICATOR is too general).
Since arbitrary predicate can be passed to getOnlineServersListWithIdlePredicator(), name it getOnlineServersListWithPredicator().

Looks good overall.

-1 overall
